sentences.english: Our revolutionary cause needs a good number of non-party people with high ideals.
sentences.chinese: 我们的革命事业还需要一批党外的志士仁人。

sentences.english: The magnificent mountains and rivers of the city have brought up a big number of people with lofty ideals.
sentences.chinese: 绍兴以其秀丽山川哺育了众多的志士仁人。

definition: gentleman aspiring to benevolence (idiom); people with lofty ideals
to give up life for righteousness (idiom, from Mencius); to choose honor over life/would rather sacrifice one's life than one's principles
The rise and fall of the nation concerns everyone (idiom). Everyone bears responsibility for the prosperity of society.
pinyin: tian1 xia4 xing1 wang2 , pi3 fu1 you3 ze2

definition: those with lofty ideals (idiom)/men of vision
to sacrifice one's wealth to save the state (idiom)
at stake/in peril
to shine through the ages (idiom)
to dedicate oneself to the cause of one's country (idiom)
to save from extinction/to save the nation
The first concern is affairs of state, enjoying the pleasure comes later. Quotation from essay On Yueyang Tower 岳陽樓記|岳阳楼记 by Song writer Fan Zhongyan 范仲淹[Fan4 Zhong4 yan1]
pinyin: xian1 tian1 xia4 zhi1 you1 er2 you1 , hou4 tian1 xia4 zhi1 le4 er2 le4
related.word: 先天下之忧而忧，后天下之乐而乐

definition: to abandon one's body in the search for Buddha's truth (idiom)
to rub one's head and heels (idiom); to slave for the benefit of others/to wear oneself out for the general good
to die without regrets (idiom); to sacrifice oneself without hesitation
for the common good and forgetting personal interests (idiom); to behave altruistically/selfless
lit. to open one's liver and drip gall (idiom); wholehearted loyalty
